intro: Swainsona purpurea, commonly known as the purple swainsona, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its tall, branching stems and showy purple-pink flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Swainsona purpurea is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its growth habit and floral display make it a notable species in its native range.
